briefdescription.para: Enable or disable the automatic video flipping for graphics.
Manually flip the video buffer to display the current drawing.

briefdescription.para: Plot a previously loaded sprite at the specified coordinates.
Set the graphics color for subsequent drawing operations.
Draw a line from one point to another on the screen.
Plot a single point on the screen at the specified x and y coordinates.
Draw a triangle on the screen defined by the three sets of x, y coordinates.
Draw a rectangle on the screen defined by two sets of x, y coordinates.
Draw a circle on the screen at the specified coordinates with a specified radius.
Converts RGB values to a single integer representing the color.

detaileddescription.para: Get the RGB color value from the provided red, green, and blue components.

simplesect.para: A combined integer representing the RGB color

memberdef.name: plot_sprite_quad

detaileddescription.para: Parses and executes the PLOTQUAD keyword from the BASIC interpreter. This statement expects a sprite handle followed by four (x,y) coordinate pairs, defining the quadrilateral to which the sprite should be mapped.

The coordinates may describe any convex quad, allowing sprites to be drawn with skew and perspective. Internally this delegates to the textured-quad blitter (plot_sprite_quad) to perform the actual rendering.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the BASIC execution context, containing parser state, sprite table, and current program environment.
